intro: Sebastiania brachyclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some tropical gardens.
